learning_objective: Design and iteratively develop computational artifacts for practical intent, personal expression, or to address a societal issue by using events to initiate instructions.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on an algorithm to simulate a population of rabbits over time. Every month, each pair of rabbits produces another pair. However, Alex wants to introduce a factor to represent a natural disaster such as a fire or flood, which can remove half of the population in one month. Which event should trigger the execution of the function to represent the disaster?",
    "Answer1": "When the population of rabbits exceeds a certain limit",
    "Answer2": "When the algorithm starts",
    "Answer3": "After every iteration of multiplying the rabbit population",
    "Answer4": "When the function to calculate the rabbit population has finished",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "A natural disaster should occur when the population becomes too large, so triggering the execution of the disaster function when the rabbit population exceeds a certain limit best represents this phenomenon. "
}
